intro: Corydalis grandicalyx f. albifloris, commonly known as the white-flowered corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and clusters of small, pale white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value and is often used in gardens for its subtle, elegant appearance.
